climbs.name: Sidewinder
climbs.fa: Craig Luebben and Thor Kieser, April 1990

content.description:
A Craig Luebben offwidth masterpiece. This is one of the most elegant and sustained offwidth pitches in the desert. If you are an offwidth climber it is an absolute must-do. It is rumored that Luebben invented the

sidewinding

technique for this spectacular pitch. The pitch requires every offwidth technique from calf-locks, to knee locks, to arm-bars and chicken wings as well as a challenging 60' of

sidewinding with a run-out chimney exit ~ Pamela Shanti Pack
content.protection: Standard desert rack, heavy on the wide pro -- 2-4x Blue Big Bros and/or BD 7 and BD 8
content.location: Sidewinder is on the North side of Long Canyon 0.7 miles up canyon from Maverick Buttress or 0.1 miles up canyon from the fallen pillar. The route climbs a wide crack system up a left facing dihedral to a ledge.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Start climbing on a tips crack that gradually opens up to 0.5 - 0.75. Arrive at a bolt, step left onto the pillar and climb up and past another bolt to the anchor. 5.12, ~75'

Pitch 2: This pitch is only hands/fists. Climb up and over a roof (protected by #2), then jam cupped hand for a long stretch. At the very end of the pitch, the crack widens to fists/rattly fists. 5.10+, ~100'

Rap route with one 70 meter rope
content.location: See overview picture. Find a weakness in the cliff band in between the Galactica Wall and Pucker Pass, then traverse left for a few minutes. This route can also be accessed from the top for TR's by parking right before the headwall at pucker pass, then hiking 4th class up and past 'Sidewinder'. Also a descent option.
